caption-side.summary: The caption-side CSS property puts the content of a table's caption on the specified side. The values are relative to the writing-mode of the table.
caption-side.title: caption-side

float-clear.summary: The clear CSS property sets whether an element must be moved below (cleared) floating elements that precede it. The clear property applies to floating and non-floating elements.
float-clear.title: clear

float-clear.summary: The float CSS property places an element on the left or right side of its container, allowing text and inline elements to wrap around it.
float-clear.title: float

logical-dimension-properties.summary: The block-size CSS property defines the horizontal or vertical size of an element's block, depending on its writing mode. It corresponds to either the width or the height property, depending on the value of writing-mode.
logical-dimension-properties.title: block-size

logical-dimension-properties.summary: The inline-size CSS property defines the horizontal or vertical size of an element's block, depending on its writing mode. It corresponds to either the width or the height property, depending on the value of writing-mode.
logical-dimension-properties.title: inline-size

logical-page.summary: The @page CSS at-rule is used to modify some CSS properties when printing a document. You can't change all CSS properties with @page. You can only change the margins, orphans, widows, and page breaks of the document. Attempts to change any other CSS properties will be ignored.
logical-page.title: @page

logical-page.summary: The page-break-after CSS property adjusts page breaks after the current element.
logical-page.title: page-break-after

logical-page.summary: The page-break-before CSS property adjusts page breaks before the current element.
logical-page.title: page-break-before

logical-shorthand-keyword.summary: The border-color shorthand CSS property sets the color of all sides of an element's border.

firefox.notes: Firefox also supports the following non-standard CSS properties to set the border sides to multiple colors: -moz-border-top-colors, -moz-border-right-colors, -moz-border-bottom-colors, -moz-border-left-colors

firefox_android.notes: Firefox also supports the following non-standard CSS properties to set the border sides to multiple colors: -moz-border-top-colors, -moz-border-right-colors, -moz-border-bottom-colors, -moz-border-left-colors

logical-shorthand-keyword.title: border-color

propdef-border-block.summary: The border-block CSS property is a shorthand property for setting the individual logical block border property values in a single place in the style sheet.
propdef-border-block.title: border-block

propdef-border-block-color.summary: The border-block-color CSS property defines the color of the logical block borders of an element, which maps to a physical border color depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the border-top-color and border-bottom-color, or border-right-color and border-left-color property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.
propdef-border-block-color.title: border-block-color

propdef-border-block-end.summary: The border-block-end CSS property is a shorthand property for setting the individual logical block-end border property values in a single place in the style sheet.
propdef-border-block-end.title: border-block-end

propdef-border-block-end-color.summary: The border-block-end-color CSS property defines the color of the logical block-end border of an element, which maps to a physical border color depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the border-top-color, border-right-color, border-bottom-color, or border-left-color property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.
propdef-border-block-end-color.title: border-block-end-color

propdef-border-block-end-style.summary: The border-block-end-style CSS property defines the style of the logical block end border of an element, which maps to a physical border style depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the border-top-style, border-right-style, border-bottom-style, or border-left-style property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.
propdef-border-block-end-style.title: border-block-end-style

propdef-border-block-end-width.summary: The border-block-end-width CSS property defines the width of the logical block-end border of an element, which maps to a physical border width depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the border-top-width, border-right-width, border-bottom-width, or border-left-width property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.
propdef-border-block-end-width.title: border-block-end-width

propdef-border-block-start.summary: The border-block-start CSS property is a shorthand property for setting the individual logical block-start border property values in a single place in the style sheet.
propdef-border-block-start.title: border-block-start

propdef-border-block-start-color.summary: The border-block-start-color CSS property defines the color of the logical block-start border of an element, which maps to a physical border color depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the border-top-color, border-right-color, border-bottom-color, or border-left-color property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.
propdef-border-block-start-color.title: border-block-start-color

propdef-border-block-start-style.summary: The border-block-start-style CSS property defines the style of the logical block start border of an element, which maps to a physical border style depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the border-top-style, border-right-style, border-bottom-style, or border-left-style property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.
propdef-border-block-start-style.title: border-block-start-style

propdef-border-block-start-width.summary: The border-block-start-width CSS property defines the width of the logical block-start border of an element, which maps to a physical border width depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the border-top-width, border-right-width, border-bottom-width, or border-left-width property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.
propdef-border-block-start-width.title: border-block-start-width

propdef-border-block-style.summary: The border-block-style CSS property defines the style of the logical block borders of an element, which maps to a physical border style depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the border-top-style and border-bottom-style, or border-left-style and border-right-style properties depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.
propdef-border-block-style.title: border-block-style

propdef-border-block-width.summary: The border-block-width CSS property defines the width of the logical block borders of an element, which maps to a physical border width depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the border-top-width and border-bottom-width, or border-left-width, and border-right-width property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.
propdef-border-block-width.title: border-block-width

propdef-border-block-width.summary: The border-inline-width CSS property defines the width of the logical inline borders of an element, which maps to a physical border width depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the border-top-width and border-bottom-width, or border-left-width, and border-right-width property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.
propdef-border-block-width.title: border-inline-width

propdef-border-end-end-radius.summary: The border-end-end-radius CSS property defines a logical border radius on an element, which maps to a physical border radius that depends on on the element's writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.
propdef-border-end-end-radius.title: border-end-end-radius

propdef-border-end-start-radius.summary: The border-end-start-radius CSS property defines a logical border radius on an element, which maps to a physical border radius depending on the element's writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.
propdef-border-end-start-radius.title: border-end-start-radius

propdef-border-inline.summary: The border-inline CSS property is a shorthand property for setting the individual logical inline border property values in a single place in the style sheet.
propdef-border-inline.title: border-inline

propdef-border-inline-color.summary: The border-inline-color CSS property defines the color of the logical inline borders of an element, which maps to a physical border color depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the border-top-color and border-bottom-color, or border-right-color and border-left-color property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.
propdef-border-inline-color.title: border-inline-color

propdef-border-inline-end.summary: The border-inline-end CSS property is a shorthand property for setting the individual logical inline-end border property values in a single place in the style sheet.
propdef-border-inline-end.title: border-inline-end

propdef-border-inline-end-color.summary: The border-inline-end-color CSS property defines the color of the logical inline-end border of an element, which maps to a physical border color depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the border-top-color, border-right-color, border-bottom-color, or border-left-color property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.
propdef-border-inline-end-color.title: border-inline-end-color

propdef-border-inline-end-style.summary: The border-inline-end-style CSS property defines the style of the logical inline end border of an element, which maps to a physical border style depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the border-top-style, border-right-style, border-bottom-style, or border-left-style property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.
propdef-border-inline-end-style.title: border-inline-end-style

propdef-border-inline-end-width.summary: The border-inline-end-width CSS property defines the width of the logical inline-end border of an element, which maps to a physical border width depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the border-top-width, border-right-width, border-bottom-width, or border-left-width property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.
propdef-border-inline-end-width.title: border-inline-end-width

propdef-border-inline-start.summary: The border-inline-start CSS property is a shorthand property for setting the individual logical inline-start border property values in a single place in the style sheet.
propdef-border-inline-start.title: border-inline-start

propdef-border-inline-start-color.summary: The border-inline-start-color CSS property defines the color of the logical inline start border of an element, which maps to a physical border color depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the border-top-color, border-right-color, border-bottom-color, or border-left-color property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.
propdef-border-inline-start-color.title: border-inline-start-color

propdef-border-inline-start-style.summary: The border-inline-start-style CSS property defines the style of the logical inline start border of an element, which maps to a physical border style depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the border-top-style, border-right-style, border-bottom-style, or border-left-style property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.
propdef-border-inline-start-style.title: border-inline-start-style

propdef-border-inline-start-width.summary: The border-inline-start-width CSS property defines the width of the logical inline-start border of an element, which maps to a physical border width depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the border-top-width, border-right-width, border-bottom-width, or border-left-width property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.
propdef-border-inline-start-width.title: border-inline-start-width

propdef-border-inline-style.summary: The border-inline-style CSS property defines the style of the logical inline borders of an element, which maps to a physical border style depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the border-top-style and border-bottom-style, or border-left-style and border-right-style properties depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.
propdef-border-inline-style.title: border-inline-style

propdef-border-start-end-radius.summary: The border-start-end-radius CSS property defines a logical border radius on an element, which maps to a physical border radius depending on the element's writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.
propdef-border-start-end-radius.title: border-start-end-radius

propdef-border-start-start-radius.summary: The border-start-start-radius CSS property defines a logical border radius on an element, which maps to a physical border radius that depends on the element's writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.
propdef-border-start-start-radius.title: border-start-start-radius

propdef-inset.summary: The inset CSS property defines the logical block and inline start and end offsets of an element, which map to physical offsets depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the top and bottom, or right and left properties depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.
propdef-inset.title: inset

propdef-inset-block.summary: The inset-block CSS property defines the logical block start and end offsets of an element, which maps to physical offsets depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the top and bottom, or right and left properties depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.
propdef-inset-block.title: inset-block

propdef-inset-block-end.summary: The inset-block-end CSS property defines the logical block end offset of an element, which maps to a physical inset depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation.
propdef-inset-block-end.title: inset-block-end

propdef-inset-block-start.summary: The inset-block-start CSS property defines the logical block start offset of an element, which maps to a physical inset depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation.
propdef-inset-block-start.title: inset-block-start

propdef-inset-inline.summary: The inset-inline CSS property defines the logical block start and end offsets of an element, which maps to physical offsets depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the top and bottom, or right and left properties depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.
propdef-inset-inline.title: inset-inline

propdef-inset-inline-end.summary: The inset-inline-end CSS property defines the logical inline end inset of an element, which maps to a physical inset depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation.
propdef-inset-inline-end.title: inset-inline-end

propdef-inset-inline-start.summary: The inset-inline-start CSS property defines the logical inline start inset of an element, which maps to a physical offset depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation.
propdef-inset-inline-start.title: inset-inline-start

propdef-margin-block.summary: The margin-block CSS property defines the logical block start and end margins of an element, which maps to physical margins depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation.
propdef-margin-block.title: margin-block

propdef-margin-block-end.summary: The margin-block-end CSS property defines the logical block end margin of an element, which maps to a physical margin depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation.
propdef-margin-block-end.title: margin-block-end

propdef-margin-block-start.summary: The margin-block-start CSS property defines the logical block start margin of an element, which maps to a physical margin depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation.
propdef-margin-block-start.title: margin-block-start

propdef-margin-inline.summary: The margin-inline CSS property defines the logical inline start and end margins of an element, which maps to physical margins depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation.
propdef-margin-inline.title: margin-inline

propdef-margin-inline-end.summary: The margin-inline-end CSS property defines the logical inline end margin of an element, which maps to a physical margin depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. In other words, it corresponds to the margin-top, margin-right, margin-bottom or margin-left property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.
propdef-margin-inline-end.title: margin-inline-end

propdef-margin-inline-start.summary: The margin-inline-start CSS property defines the logical inline start margin of an element, which maps to a physical margin depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the margin-top, margin-right, margin-bottom, or margin-left property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.
propdef-margin-inline-start.title: margin-inline-start

propdef-max-block-size.summary: The max-block-size CSS property specifies the maximum size of an element in the direction opposite that of the writing direction as specified by writing-mode.
propdef-max-block-size.title: max-block-size

propdef-max-inline-size.summary: The max-inline-size CSS property defines the horizontal or vertical maximum size of an element's block depending on its writing mode. It corresponds to the max-width or the max-height property depending on the value defined for writing-mode. If the writing mode is vertically oriented, the value of max-inline-size relates to the maximal height of the element, otherwise it relates to the maximal width of the element. It relates to max-block-size, which defines the other dimension of the element.
propdef-max-inline-size.title: max-inline-size

propdef-min-block-size.summary: The min-block-size CSS property defines the minimum horizontal or vertical size of an element's block, depending on its writing mode. It corresponds to either the min-width or the min-height property, depending on the value of writing-mode.
propdef-min-block-size.title: min-block-size

propdef-min-inline-size.summary: The min-inline-size CSS property defines the horizontal or vertical minimal size of an element's block, depending on its writing mode. It corresponds to either the min-width or the min-height property, depending on the value of writing-mode.
propdef-min-inline-size.title: min-inline-size

propdef-padding-block.summary: The padding-block CSS property defines the logical block start and end padding of an element, which maps to physical padding properties depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation.
propdef-padding-block.title: padding-block

propdef-padding-block-end.summary: The padding-block-end CSS property defines the logical block end padding of an element, which maps to a physical padding depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the padding-top, padding-right, padding-bottom, or padding-left property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.
propdef-padding-block-end.title: padding-block-end

propdef-padding-block-start.summary: The padding-block-start CSS property defines the logical block start padding of an element, which maps to a physical padding depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the padding-top, padding-right, padding-bottom, or padding-left property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.
propdef-padding-block-start.title: padding-block-start

propdef-padding-inline.summary: The padding-inline CSS property defines the logical inline start and end padding of an element, which maps to physical padding properties depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation.
propdef-padding-inline.title: padding-inline

propdef-padding-inline-end.summary: The padding-inline-end CSS property defines the logical inline end padding of an element, which maps to a physical padding depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the padding-top, padding-right, padding-bottom, or padding-left property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.
propdef-padding-inline-end.title: padding-inline-end

propdef-padding-inline-start.summary: The padding-inline-start CSS property defines the logical inline start padding of an element, which maps to a physical padding depending on the element's writing mode, directionality, and text orientation. It corresponds to the padding-top, padding-right, padding-bottom, or padding-left property depending on the values defined for writing-mode, direction, and text-orientation.
propdef-padding-inline-start.title: padding-inline-start

resize.summary: The resize CSS property sets whether an element is resizable, and if so, in which directions.
resize.title: resize

text-align.summary: The text-align CSS property sets the horizontal alignment of an inline or table-cell box. This means it works like vertical-align but in the horizontal direction.
text-align.title: text-align
